alert.note: Alert for Coweta; Fayette; Spalding (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 31 at 7:31AM EST until further notice by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Line Creek near Senoia affecting Coweta, Fayette and Spalding Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Line Creek near Senoia. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 13.5 feet, Minor flooding of the natural flood plain expands further into agricultural and wooded areas. The water level reaches the bottom of the USGS gage house. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:01 AM EST Friday the stage was 11.8 feet and falling. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:01 AM EST Friday was 12.1 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 10 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.9 feet on 02/19/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
